text: The Women Basketball Friendship Adriatic League, shortly WBFAL, was a regional basketball league featuring female teams from Montenegro, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Croatia. ==History== ==Finals== {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:100%" |- !rowspan=2 width=7%|Year !colspan=3|Final !colspan=3|Third and fourth place |- !width=15%|Winner !width=8%|Score !width=15%|Runner-up !width=15%|Third place !width=15%|Fourth place |- |2012–13 Details | Budućnost Podgorica |73:63 | Ragusa Dubrovnik | Primorje | Rolling Nikšić |- |2013–14 Details | Budućnost Podgorica |60:51 | Ragusa Dubrovnik | Lovćen | Primorje |- |2014–15 Details | Ragusa Dubrovnik |2:0 | Jalaa SC | Nikšić 1995 | Trebinje 03 |} ==Champions== {| class="wikitable" width=80% |- !width=20%| Team !width=5%| Winners !width=5%| Runners-up !width=20%| Years won !width=20%| Years runner-up |- | Budućnost Podgorica | 2 | – | 2013, 2014 | – |- | Ragusa Dubrovnik | 1 | 2 | 2015 | 2013, 2014 |- | Lovćen | – | 1 | – | 2015 |} ==External links== * * Profile at eurobasket.com Category:Defunct women's basketball leagues in Europe Category:Sports leagues established in 2012 Category:Defunct multi-national basketball leagues in Europe Category:2012 establishments in Europe Category:Basketball leagues in Croatia Category:Basketball leagues in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Basketball leagues in Montenegro Category:Women's basketball competitions in Croatia Category:Women's basketball competitions in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Women's basketball competitions in Montenegro Category:Multi-national women's basketball leagues in Europe
title: WBFAL
